comments.body: I thought there was a label printer func.
seems like this is how it is done for the other resources.

https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/29b73cc4b566e8e93fa64263f670a06cfdbfc98a/pkg/kubectl/kubectl.go#L122

It displays <none>, which is about the size of the label header in a table.  I'm not sure it was a conscious decision not to use it except maybe eliding the column if they were all empty.

> On Nov 24, 2014, at 11:26 AM, Eric Tune notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In pkg/kubecfg/resource_printer.go:
> 
> > @@ -249,7 +249,7 @@ func printServiceList(list *api.ServiceList, w io.Writer) error {
> >  }
> > 
> >  func printMinion(minion *api.Minion, w io.Writer) error {
> > -   _, err := fmt.Fprintf(w, "%s\n", minion.Name)
> > -   _, err := fmt.Fprintf(w, "%s\t%s\n", minion.Name, labels.Set(minion.Labels))
> >   seems like this is how it is done for the other resources.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
Use <none> makes more sense if we don't elide the column.
Please add a verbose description of what a printFunc is and does. :)
